action.action-desc: Mr. Loebsack introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on House Administration, and in addition to the Committees on Oversight and Government Reform, Energy and Commerce, and Ways and Means, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To provide for the health coverage of Members of Congress to be affected if the rate of individuals without health insurance increases.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Hold Congress Accountable on Healthcare Act.

section.header: Members of Congress health coverage affected if certain health insurance protections are not satisfied

subsection.text: Notwithstanding any other provision of law, subject to subsection (b), Members of Congress—

paragraph.text: will no longer be eligible to be enrolled under a health plan offered through an Exchange established under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act;
will no longer be eligible to be enrolled for a health plan under the Federal Employees Health Benefit Program under chapter 89 of title 5, United States Code;
will no longer be eligible to be enrolled, or entitled to benefits, under any other Federal health care program; and
will no longer be eligible for any Federal subsidy or tax credit with respect to health insurance coverage.

subsection.text: Subsection (a) shall take effect on such date that—

paragraph.text: legislation is enacted that changes the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act; and
the enactment of such legislation results in the rate of individuals who do not have health insurance coverage increasing from the rate as of January 20, 2017.
